text: Thanks for your input Gabriel. Almost all the packages do not have duplicate entries (only: boot, class, cluster, codetools, foreign, KernSmooth, lattice, MASS, Matrix, mgcv, nlme, nnet, rpart, spatial, survival, RODBC and XML), so specifying a package for an R version can't be the reason (where are the entries for all the other packages for all the other R versions?). About a), Matrix is recommended not base package (which are not on CRAN), many of them are recommended packages but some of them (last two) are not, so it is not that recommended packages receive a special treatment on CRAN (or some non-recommended packages receive the same treatment).
